items.title: Record renewables auction supports 7,000 jobs and £3bn investment
items.summary: Workers across Britain will benefit from billions of pounds of private sector investment in ports and supply chains.

items.title: Guidance: Training on export control compliance
items.summary: Courses, seminars, workshops and webinars to help exporters understand their obligations under export control legislation.

items.title: Research: Retained EU law and assimilated law dashboard
items.summary: This dashboard shows a list of retained EU law (REUL) and assimilated law. These are laws that the UK saved to ensure legislative continuity immediately after Brexit.

items.title: Research: Retained EU Law (REUL) and Assimilated Law Parliamentary Reports
items.summary: The Reports fulfil a statutory duty to provide updates as set out in the REUL Act.

items.title: Statutory guidance: People with significant control: company statutory guidance 2026
items.summary: This draft statutory guidance explains how ‘significant influence or control’ should be interpreted for companies.

items.title: Statutory guidance: People with significant control: LLP statutory guidance 2026
items.summary: This draft statutory guidance explains how ‘significant influence or control’ should be interpreted for limited liability partnerships (LLPs).

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, March 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, April 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, February 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, October 2024
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, November 2024
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Transparency data: DESNZ: spending over £25,000, June 2025
items.summary: Reports on departmental spending over £25,000.

items.title: Guidance: UK greenhouse gas emissions statistics: planned methodology changes
items.summary: 2026 changes to methods used to estimate UK greenhouse gas emissions.

items.title: Electricity licence exemptions
items.summary: Electricity companies, under certain criteria, can be exempt from electricity generation, transmission, distribution or supply licences.

items.title: Policy paper: Grenfell Tower Inquiry Government Progress Report
items.summary: This page sets out the government’s progress on the Grenfell Tower Inquiry’s Phase 2 recommendations and updates on Phase 1 recommendations.

items.title: Policy paper: Grenfell Tower Inquiry Government Progress Report translations
items.summary: Translations of the December 2025 Grenfell Tower Inquiry Government Progress Report summary update.

items.title: Correspondence: Ministerial letter on the Industrial Strategy Advisory Council
items.summary: A letter from the Chancellor of the Exchequer and the Secretary of State for Business and Trade setting out the mandate of the Industrial Strategy Advisory Council.

items.title: Guidance: Agents for professional sports persons
items.summary: Guidance to agents for professional sports persons to comply with the Employment Agencies Act 1973 (the act) and Conduct of Employment Agencies and Employment Businesses Regulations 2003 (the conduct regulations).

items.title: Policy paper: Industrial Strategy quarterly update: October to December 2025
items.summary: An update on delivery of commitments in the Industrial Strategy.

items.title: Research: Unabated gas: cost and technical assumptions
items.summary: Cost assumptions for new unabated gas projects, as well as the costs of extending the life of existing unabated gas projects in Great Britain.

items.title: Research: Gas carbon capture plant capital expenditure benchmarking: methodology
items.summary: An outline of the approach used to benchmark capital expenditure (CAPEX) for gas fired power plants with post combustion carbon capture and storage (CCS).

items.title: Research: Offshore wind cost and technical assumptions: peer review
items.summary: A peer review assessing and providing assurances regarding the robustness of the offshore wind research conducted by Arup.

items.title: Research: Offshore wind: cost and technical assumptions
items.summary: This report provides an update to information on renewable energy generation costs and technical assumptions for offshore wind.

items.title: Research: Hydrogen to power: cost and technical assumptions
items.summary: This report provides an update to information on cost and barriers for hydrogen to power.

items.title: Notice: Contracts for Difference (CfD) Allocation Round 7: statutory notices
items.summary: Final statutory notices required to launch Contracts for Difference Allocation Round 7.

items.title: Accredited official statistics: Building materials and components statistics: December 2025
items.summary: Statistics and analysis on the construction sector for December 2025.

items.title: Business Secretary wants UK to go ‘toe to toe’ with America on growth
items.summary: In a speech to top business leaders the Business Secretary will lay out how the Government’s Modern Industrial Strategy will double down on the UK’s world-leading strengths in 2026 and not only scale up businesses, but keep them anchored in the UK.

items.title: Business Secretary bolsters advisory council to grow UK industry
items.summary: The Business Secretary has appointed three new business leaders to the Industrial Strategy Advisory Council.

items.title: Record breaking auction for offshore wind secured to take back control of Britain's energy
items.summary: A record 8.4GW of offshore wind secured in Europe’s biggest ever offshore wind auction.

items.title: Research: Electricity generation costs 2025
items.summary: Report on levelised cost estimates for electricity generation technologies, detailing methodology, data and assumptions.

items.title: Guidance: Subsidy Control Act 2022: Streamlined Routes
items.summary: Streamlined Routes (also known as Streamlined Subsidy Schemes) are a type of subsidy scheme made by the UK government for use by any UK public authority.

items.title: Independent report: Impacts of minimum wages: review of the international evidence
items.summary: An independent report on the impacts of minimum wages, to inform the UK government’s decisions on the remit of the Low Pay Commission beyond 2020.

items.title: Promotional material: Employment Rights Act 2025: factsheets
items.summary: Further details on the measures included within the Employment Rights Act 2025.

items.title: Guidance: Capture Redress Scheme: independent panel and panel chair privacy notice
items.summary: How the Capture Redress Scheme independent panel and the panel chair  will process your personal data.

items.title: Stronger parental leave rights to give millions of working families the “security they deserve”
items.summary: New day one rights to parental leave set to enter force from April.

items.title: Statutory guidance: Code of practice: industrial action ballots and notice to employers
items.summary: Practical guidance to trade unions and employers to promote the improvement of industrial relations and good practice in the conduct of trade union industrial action ballots.

items.title: Guidance: Code of practice: picketing
items.summary: Guidance on picketing for employers, workers or members of the public who may be affected by a picket or any associated activities.
